trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication - How it works
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication - How it works

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication helps safeguard access to data and applications while meeting user demand for a simple sign-in process.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication helps safeguard access to data and applications while meeting user demand for a simple sign-in process.

trans-unit.source: It provides additional security by requiring a second form of authentication and delivers strong authentication via a range of easy verification options.
trans-unit.target: It provides additional security by requiring a second form of authentication and delivers strong authentication via a range of easy verification options.

trans-unit.source: How Azure Multi-Factor Authentication works
trans-unit.target: How Azure Multi-Factor Authentication works

trans-unit.source: The security of multi-factor authentication lies in its layered approach.
trans-unit.target: The security of multi-factor authentication lies in its layered approach.

trans-unit.source: Compromising multiple authentication factors presents a significant challenge for attackers.
trans-unit.target: Compromising multiple authentication factors presents a significant challenge for attackers.

trans-unit.source: Even if an attacker manages to learn the user's password, it is useless without also having possession of the trusted device.
trans-unit.target: Even if an attacker manages to learn the user's password, it is useless without also having possession of the trusted device.

trans-unit.source: Should the user lose the device, the person who finds it won't be able to use it unless he or she also knows the user's password.
trans-unit.target: Should the user lose the device, the person who finds it won't be able to use it unless he or she also knows the user's password.

trans-unit.source: Proofup
trans-unit.target: Proofup

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication helps safeguard access to data and applications while meeting user demand for a simple sign-in process.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication helps safeguard access to data and applications while meeting user demand for a simple sign-in process.

trans-unit.source: It provides additional security by requiring a second form of authentication and delivers strong authentication via a range of easy verification options:
trans-unit.target: It provides additional security by requiring a second form of authentication and delivers strong authentication via a range of easy verification options:

trans-unit.source: phone call
trans-unit.target: phone call

trans-unit.source: text message
trans-unit.target: text message

trans-unit.source: mobile app notification—allowing users to choose the method they prefer
trans-unit.target: mobile app notification—allowing users to choose the method they prefer

trans-unit.source: mobile app verification code
trans-unit.target: mobile app verification code

trans-unit.source: 3rd party OATH tokens
trans-unit.target: 3rd party OATH tokens

trans-unit.source: For additional information oh how it works see the following video.
trans-unit.target: For additional information oh how it works see the following video.

trans-unit.source: Methods available for multi-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Methods available for multi-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: When a user signs in, an additional verification is sent to the user.
trans-unit.target: When a user signs in, an additional verification is sent to the user.

trans-unit.source: The following are a list of methods that can be used for this second verification.
trans-unit.target: The following are a list of methods that can be used for this second verification.

trans-unit.source: Verification Method
trans-unit.target: Verification Method

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Phone Call
trans-unit.target: Phone Call

trans-unit.source: A call is placed to a user’s smart phone asking them to verify that they are signing in by pressing the # sign.
trans-unit.target: A call is placed to a user’s smart phone asking them to verify that they are signing in by pressing the # sign.

trans-unit.source: This will complete the verification process.
trans-unit.target: This will complete the verification process.

trans-unit.source: This option is configurable and can be changed to a code that you specify.
trans-unit.target: This option is configurable and can be changed to a code that you specify.

trans-unit.source: Text Message
trans-unit.target: Text Message

trans-unit.source: A text message will be sent to a user’s smart phone with a 6 digit code.
trans-unit.target: A text message will be sent to a user’s smart phone with a 6 digit code.

trans-unit.source: Enter this code in to complete the verification process.
trans-unit.target: Enter this code in to complete the verification process.

trans-unit.source: Mobile App Notification
trans-unit.target: Mobile App Notification

trans-unit.source: A verification request will be sent to a user’s smart phone asking them complete the verification by selecting Verify from the mobile app.
trans-unit.target: A verification request will be sent to a user’s smart phone asking them complete the verification by selecting Verify from the mobile app.

trans-unit.source: This will occur if you selected app notification as your primary verification method.
trans-unit.target: This will occur if you selected app notification as your primary verification method.

trans-unit.source: If they receive this when they are not signing in, they can choose to report it as fraud.
trans-unit.target: If they receive this when they are not signing in, they can choose to report it as fraud.

trans-unit.source: Verification code with Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Verification code with Mobile App

trans-unit.source: A verification code will be sent to the mobile app that is running on a user’s smart phone.
trans-unit.target: A verification code will be sent to the mobile app that is running on a user’s smart phone.

trans-unit.source: This will occur if you selected a verification code as your primary verification method.
trans-unit.target: This will occur if you selected a verification code as your primary verification method.

trans-unit.source: Available versions of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication
trans-unit.target: Available versions of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication is available in three different versions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication is available in three different versions.

trans-unit.source: The table below describes each of these in more detail.
trans-unit.target: The table below describes each of these in more detail.

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication for Office 365
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication for Office 365

trans-unit.source: This version works exclusively with Office 365 applications and is managed from the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: This version works exclusively with Office 365 applications and is managed from the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: So administrators can now help secure their Office 365 resources by using multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: So administrators can now help secure their Office 365 resources by using multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: This version comes with an Office 365 subscription.
trans-unit.target: This version comes with an Office 365 subscription.

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication for Azure Administrators
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication for Azure Administrators

trans-unit.source: The same subset of Multi-Factor Authentication capabilities for Office 365 will be available at no cost to all Azure administrators.
trans-unit.target: The same subset of Multi-Factor Authentication capabilities for Office 365 will be available at no cost to all Azure administrators.

trans-unit.source: Every administrative account of a Azure subscription can now get additional protection by enabling this core multi-factor authentication functionality.
trans-unit.target: Every administrative account of a Azure subscription can now get additional protection by enabling this core multi-factor authentication functionality.

trans-unit.source: So an administrator that wants to access Azure portal to create a VM, a web site, manage storage, mobile services or any other Azure Service can add multi-factor authentication to his administrator account.
trans-unit.target: So an administrator that wants to access Azure portal to create a VM, a web site, manage storage, mobile services or any other Azure Service can add multi-factor authentication to his administrator account.

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication offers the richest set of capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication offers the richest set of capabilities.

trans-unit.source: It provides additional configuration options via the Azure Management portal, advanced reporting, and support for a range of on-premises and cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: It provides additional configuration options via the Azure Management portal, advanced reporting, and support for a range of on-premises and cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication comes as part of Azure Active Directory Premium.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication comes as part of Azure Active Directory Premium.

trans-unit.source: Feature comparison of versions
trans-unit.target: Feature comparison of versions

trans-unit.source: The following table below provides a list of the features that are available in the various versions of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: The following table below provides a list of the features that are available in the various versions of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication for Office 365 (included in Office 365 SKUs)
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication for Office 365 (included in Office 365 SKUs)

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication for Azure Administrators (included with Azure subscription)
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication for Azure Administrators (included with Azure subscription)

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (included in Azure AD Premium and Enterprise Mobility Suite)
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (included in Azure AD Premium and Enterprise Mobility Suite)

trans-unit.source: Administrators can protect accounts with MFA
trans-unit.target: Administrators can protect accounts with MFA

trans-unit.source: * (Available only for Azure Administrator accounts)
trans-unit.target: * (Available only for Azure Administrator accounts)

trans-unit.source: Mobile app as a second factor
trans-unit.target: Mobile app as a second factor

trans-unit.source: Phone call as a second factor
trans-unit.target: Phone call as a second factor

trans-unit.source: SMS as a second factor
trans-unit.target: SMS as a second factor

trans-unit.source: App passwords for clients that don't support MFA
trans-unit.target: App passwords for clients that don't support MFA

trans-unit.source: Admin control over authentication methods
trans-unit.target: Admin control over authentication methods

trans-unit.source: PIN mode
trans-unit.target: PIN mode

trans-unit.source: Fraud alert
trans-unit.target: Fraud alert

trans-unit.source: MFA Reports
trans-unit.target: MFA Reports

trans-unit.source: One-Time Bypass
trans-unit.target: One-Time Bypass

trans-unit.source: Custom greetings for phone calls
trans-unit.target: Custom greetings for phone calls

trans-unit.source: Customization of caller ID for phone calls
trans-unit.target: Customization of caller ID for phone calls

trans-unit.source: Event Confirmation
trans-unit.target: Event Confirmation

trans-unit.source: Trusted IPs
trans-unit.target: Trusted IPs

trans-unit.source: Suspend MFA for remembered devices (Public Preview)
trans-unit.target: Suspend MFA for remembered devices (Public Preview)

trans-unit.source: MFA SDK
trans-unit.target: MFA SDK

trans-unit.source: MFA for on-premises applications using MFA server
trans-unit.target: MFA for on-premises applications using MFA server

trans-unit.source: How to get Azure Multi-Factor Authentication
trans-unit.target: How to get Azure Multi-Factor Authentication

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication comes as part of Azure Active Directory Premium and the Enterprise Mobility Suite.
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication comes as part of Azure Active Directory Premium and the Enterprise Mobility Suite.

trans-unit.source: If you already have these then you have Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you already have these then you have Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you are an Office 365 users or an Azure subscriber and want to take advantage of the additional features provide by Azure Multi-Factor Authentication then continue reading.
trans-unit.target: If you are an Office 365 users or an Azure subscriber and want to take advantage of the additional features provide by Azure Multi-Factor Authentication then continue reading.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have any of the above, then to begin using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication, you first need an Azure subscription or an [Azure trial subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you do not have any of the above, then to begin using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication, you first need an Azure subscription or an [Azure trial subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: When using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication there are two billing options available:
trans-unit.target: When using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication there are two billing options available:

trans-unit.source: **Per User**.
trans-unit.target: **Per User**.

trans-unit.source: Generally for enterprises that want to enable multi-factor authentication for a fixed number of employees who regularly need authentication.
trans-unit.target: Generally for enterprises that want to enable multi-factor authentication for a fixed number of employees who regularly need authentication.

trans-unit.source: **Per Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: **Per Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Generally for enterprises that want to enable multi-factor authentication for a large group of external users who infrequently need authentication.
trans-unit.target: Generally for enterprises that want to enable multi-factor authentication for a large group of external users who infrequently need authentication.

trans-unit.source: For pricing details see [Azure MFA Pricing.](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/multi-factor-authentication/)
trans-unit.target: For pricing details see [Azure MFA Pricing.](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/multi-factor-authentication/)

trans-unit.source: Choose the model that works best for your organization.
trans-unit.target: Choose the model that works best for your organization.

trans-unit.source: Then to get started see [Getting Started](multi-factor-authentication-get-started.md)
trans-unit.target: Then to get started see [Getting Started](multi-factor-authentication-get-started.md)
